alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:16AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to slowly recede. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. This river forecast has 24 hours of forecast precipitation any precipitation beyond the 24 hour period will cause a delayed recession and perhaps a second crest. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 05/09/1950. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Snake River Pine City 9.0 9.4 Wed 10 am CD 9.3 9.1 8.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM CDT.
